goal.ch:
Mission statement: To enhance learners’ English communication competence through TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) materials, also helping them prepare for the TOEIC tests and build their confidence in using English.
Objective Methods: 
1. Interactive Lectures: Covering key concepts of TOEIC tests and crucial strategies for test preparation.
2. Practice Tests: Implementing mini tests that mimic the TOEIC format on different skills.
3. Vocabulary Games: Conducting weekly games to enhance students’ understanding and retention of relevant vocabulary.
4. Study Reports: Offering regular feedback on students’ performance to identify areas for improvement and track progress.
Expected Outcome: Upon completing the course, students can advance their business English communication competence to CEFR Level B2 or higher, as can be verified by official TOEIC to significantly enhance their job prospects.

outline.en:
**Our lessons and evaluations commence from Week 1 for all students, whether registered or interested. Attending classes is critical to avoid credit loss.
**Language acquisition takes time and effort on a regular basis.
**Class announcements will be posted on new ee-class in due course: https://ncueeclass.ncu.edu.tw/. Students are required to follow the updates there on a weekly basis.
**Our class is aiming for a TOEIC Listening ＆ Reading Test score range of 785 ~ 940.
